intro: Stillingia diversifolia, commonly known as the diverseleaf stillingia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, branched stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its leaves are typically lobed and vary in shape, contributing to its common name. Stillingia diversifolia is often found in rocky or forested habitats at higher elevations.
